medical_history.chief_complaint: Dyspnea on exertion, fatigue, and confusion.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in her usual state of health until 18 months prior, when elevated blood pressure was noted. Symptoms of swelling in the legs, abdominal distention, intermittent dyspnea on exertion, and fatigue developed four weeks before admission. There were also two episodes of burning chest pain during exercise that lasted for 2 minutes each and were relieved with rest. Symptoms progressed, with increased confusion and persistent hypokalemia noted after initial hospitalizations.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of endometriosis and dysmenorrhea treated with a levonorgestrel-releasing intrauterine system; remote history of palpitations not associated with evidence of arrhythmia.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother and sister had both had venous thromboses and miscarriages; maternal uncle had hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.
medical_history.social_history: The patient did not drink alcohol, smoke tobacco, or use illicit drugs. She was married and worked as a lawyer.
